word_mean: 传染性的，能引起感染的，有病原体存在的

sentence.Network_en: These organisms penetrate into snails, multiply, and develop into cercariae , the infective form for man.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些毛蚴进体螺体, 繁殖和发育对人类有传染性的尾蚴.

sentence.Network_en: The tears also contain a potent microbe - killer called lysozyme, which guards me from infective bacteria.
sentence.Network_cn: 眼泪里还包含一种叫做溶菌酶的高效力杀菌者, 保护我不受细菌感染.

sentence.Network_en: Some kind of anti - infective medical device has been trial - produced with this material.
sentence.Network_cn: 并进行了 抗 感染医疗器械的试制.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin infectivus, from inficere 'to taint' (see infect)

entry.def: Infective means related to infection or likely to cause infection.

example.ex: ...a mild and very common infective disease of children.
example.tran: 一种不太严重的常见儿童传染疾病

means.word_mean: 2. caused by infection or capable of causing infection;

sentences.sentence: "a carrier remains infective without himself showing signs of the disease"

auth_sentence.content: These in turn contain thread-like ascospores, which usually break into fragments and are presumably infective.
